Posts.EditableText:
I've created a small sound effect to play when my game starts. (I'm using the Desktop editor)
However, for whatever reason, it doesn't want to play.

I've converted it to .wav, mp3, used different bitrates and still have no luck.
The script is only the Playsound script. There are no flags needed, attributes, or anything of that nature. Simply loads as the game starts.

Does anyone know what I might be doing wrong here?


******EDIT******
 I DID NOT REALIZE THAT THERE WAS AN OPTION TO DISABLE SOUNDS IN QUEST. OOPS. 
Never remembered even pressing that... Ain't that wonderful.
Posts.HTML:
I've created a small sound effect to play when my game starts. (I'm using the Desktop editor)
However, for whatever reason, it doesn't want to play.

I've converted it to .wav, mp3, used different bitrates and still have no luck.
The script is only the Playsound script. There are no flags needed, attributes, or anything of that nature. Simply loads as the game starts.

Does anyone know what I might be doing wrong here?

EDIT
I DID NOT REALIZE THAT THERE WAS AN OPTION TO DISABLE SOUNDS IN QUEST. OOPS.
Never remembered even pressing that... Ain't that wonderful.

Posts.EditableText: Is the sound file in the same folder as the game?
Posts.HTML: Is the sound file in the same folder as the game?

Posts.EditableText:
"Is the sound file in the same folder as the game?"
Yes. I've made sure the directory was correct.
Posts.HTML:
"Is the sound file in the same folder as the game?"
Yes. I've made sure the directory was correct.

Posts.EditableText: Oh my gosh... I am so dumb lol. The problem was that I had "Play Sounds" disabled in Options. I don't even remember turning that off.. So much time wasted. Well, happy to report sounds are functional once again!
Posts.HTML: Oh my gosh... I am so dumb lol. The problem was that I had "Play Sounds" disabled in Options. I don't even remember turning that off.. So much time wasted. Well, happy to report sounds are functional once again!

Posts.EditableText: It's the little things that will get you... Glad you solved it. Have fun.
Posts.HTML: It's the little things that will get you... Glad you solved it. Have fun.
